definitions.definition: be entitled to a particular benefit or privilege by fulfilling a necessary condition.
examples: they do not qualify for compensation payments
synonyms: meet the requirements for; Morebe entitled to
be permitted "I qualify for free prescriptions"

definitions.definition: become eligible for a competition or its final rounds, by reaching a certain standard or defeating a competitor.
examples: he failed to qualify for the Olympic team

definitions.definition: be or make properly entitled to be classed in a particular way.
examples: he qualifies as a genuine political refugee

definitions.definition: become officially recognized as a practitioner of a particular profession or activity by satisfying the relevant conditions or requirements, typically by undertaking a course of study and passing examinations.
examples: after the war he qualified as a lawyer
synonyms: pass muster "she qualified as a doctor"

definitions.definition: officially recognize or establish (someone) as a practitioner of a particular profession or activity.
examples: the courses qualify you as an instructor of the sport
synonyms: teach "the course qualified them to teach"

definitions.definition: make (someone) competent or knowledgeable enough to do something.
examples: I'm not qualified to write on the subject

definitions.definition: make (a statement or assertion) less absolute; add reservations to.
examples: she felt obliged to qualify her first short answer

definitions.definition: make (something extreme or undesirable) less severe or extreme.
examples: his sincere piety and his large heart always qualify his errors

definitions.definition: alter the strength or flavor of (something, especially a liquid).
examples: he qualified his mug of water with a plentiful infusion of the liquor

definitions.definition: attribute a specified quality to something; describe something as.
examples: the propositions have been qualified as heretical

definitions.definition: (of a word or phrase) attribute a quality to (another word, especially a preceding noun).
